titles.title: Permitting the use of the rotunda of the Capitol for a ceremony to commemorate the days of remembrance of victims of the Holocaust.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Libraries and Memorials.
Mr. Frost moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Laid on the table. See S. Con. Res. 13 for further action.

bill.summary: 3/23/1993--Passed House amended. Allows use of the rotunda of the Capitol on April 20, 1993, and April 6, 1994, for ceremonies to observe the days of remembrance of victims of the Holocaust.
